function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Historical pandemics like cholera, typhoid, tuberculosis, and the third plague pandemic have influenced the design and infrastructure of the built environment, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased vulnerability to the spread of infectious diseases due to historical design and infrastructure influenced by past pandemics.","Mitigation":"Evaluate and update existing infrastructure and designs to incorporate modern disease prevention measures, such as improved ventilation, sanitation, and spatial planning.","Technologies":"Advanced ventilation systems, antibacterial and antiviral surfaces, smart building technologies for real-time monitoring, and contactless systems.","People":"Residents, workers, and visitors in built environments.","Owner":"Urban planners, architects, building owners, and developers."},{"Description":"The current health crisis, particularly the COVID-19 pandemic, has directly impacted urban planning and architecture, necessitating the development of built environments with enhanced security measures to prevent the spread of infections and diseases.","Impact":"Heightened awareness of the importance of designing built environments with built-in security layers to mitigate the spread of infectious diseases.","Mitigation":"Research and development of strategies that integrate health and safety measures into urban planning and architecture, such as promoting healthier building materials, adaptable spaces, and contactless infrastructure.","Technologies":"Smart sensors, IoT devices, data analytics, and digital platforms for monitoring and controlling building environments.","People":"Urban planners, architects, policymakers, and public health officials.","Owner":"Government agencies, private developers, building owners, and community organizations."}]}
